remarks: Rearrange an infinite series by spacing out the terms using an order isomorphism.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 6-Apr-2015.)
statement:
isercoll.z $e |- Z = ( ZZ>= ` M ) $.
isercoll.m $e |- ( ph -> M e. ZZ ) $.
isercoll.g $e |- ( ph -> G : NN --> Z ) $.
isercoll.i $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. NN ) -> ( G ` k ) < ( G ` ( k + 1 ) ) ) $.
isercoll.0 $e |- ( ( ph /\ n e. ( Z \ ran G ) ) -> ( F ` n ) = 0 ) $.
isercoll.f $e |- ( ( ph /\ n e. Z ) -> ( F ` n ) e. CC ) $.
isercoll.h $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. NN ) -> ( H ` k ) = ( F ` ( G ` k ) ) ) $.
isercoll $p |- ( ph -> ( seq 1 ( + , H ) ~~> A <-> seq M ( + , F ) ~~> A ) ) $.
$d A k n $.
$d F k n $.
$d G k n $.
$d H k n $.
$d M k n $.
$d Z n $.
$d k n $.
$d k n ph $.
